alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:24PM MDT until May 27 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL WELD COUNTY... At 523 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Barnesville to 4 miles northeast of Roggen to 3 miles south of Keenesburg, or along a line extending from 20 miles east of Greeley to 27 miles west of Fort Morgan to 32 miles northeast of Denver, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Keenesburg, Prospect Valley, Riverside Reservoir and Roggen. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
